Pre-Game Insights: The Milwaukee Brewers host the New York Mets on Friday to start a three-game series.
The Brewers have the fourth-best team on-base percentage in MLB play at.326.
The Mets are 59-18 in games when they scored five or more runs.
Friday's game is the fourth time these teams square off this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Willy Adames has 33 doubles, 32 home runs and 111 RBI while hitting.251 for the Brewers.
William Contreras is 11-for-34 with two doubles and two home runs over the last 10 games.
Francisco Lindor leads the Mets with a.271 batting average, and has 39 doubles, a triple, 31 home runs, 54 walks and 86 RBI.
Jose Iglesias is 18-for-43 with a home run and two RBI over the last 10 games.
Others: The Brewers have a 91-68 record overall and a 45-33 record at home.
New York has a 41-35 record in road games and an 87-70 record overall.
The Brewers' pitching probable is Frankie Montas (7-11, 4.85 ERA, 1.37 WHIP, 142 strikeouts) and the Mets' pitching probable is Sean Manaea (12-5, 3.29 ERA, 1.06 WHIP, 183 strikeouts).
